snippet: The classic All Star has been a boon to Nike, which bought Converse in 2003. But as the shoe gets an update, the company is being cautious not to damage its appeal.
abstract: Jeff Sommer Strategies column examines how Nike has been extremely careful in way it treats its Converse Chuck Taylor All Star sneakers, widely known as Chucks; notes that Chucks are important revenue and earnings source for company, and it has avoided branding shoes with its logo or name, continuing to preserve sneaker's original, signature classic look.
lead_paragraph: The classic All Star has been a boon to Nike, which bought Converse in 2003. But as the shoe gets an update, the company is being cautious not to damage its appeal.

headline.print_headline: Treading Carefully to Update a Well-Worn Sneaker Brand
headline.main: Converse Treads Carefully in Updating Well-Worn Chuck Taylor Brand
